That's fantastic! It sounds like you're experiencing significant gains in your upper body strength, which is awesome! Being able to lift 15-pound dumbbells with ease is a great achievement, and it's clear that your consistent yoga practice is paying off.

It's also great to hear that you're seeing improvements in your spin class performance. Being able to sustain a high intensity for longer periods is a testament to your increased endurance and cardiovascular fitness. Yoga can help improve your overall cardiovascular health by increasing blood flow, reducing blood pressure, and boosting oxygenation of the body.

The improvements you're seeing in your spin class performance are likely due to a combination of factors, including increased strength, endurance, and flexibility. Yoga can help improve your overall athletic performance by increasing power, speed, and agility, as well as reducing your risk of injury.

It's also worth noting that yoga can help improve your mental toughness and focus, which can be a huge advantage in high-intensity workouts like spin class. When you're able to stay focused and present, you can push yourself harder and perform at a higher level.

What's your favorite part about seeing improvements in your fitness and performance? Is it the sense of accomplishment, the feeling of getting stronger, or something else entirely?

Also, have you considered setting any new fitness goals for yourself, such as increasing your dumbbell weight or taking on more challenging spin classes?
